proc on /proc type proc (rw): what do i click to mount a hard drive?
type in a console sudo mount /dev/<drivedesignation> -t <filesystemtype> /<mountpath>
type in a console sudo mount /dev/<drivedesignation> -t <filesystemtype> /<mountpath> :)  what part do you want explained?
you can use any folder you want, as long as its empty
linux doesnt use letters for drive designation
you drive will be /dev/hda1 for primary pata master partition1, /dev/hdb1 for secondary master partition1, and so on
sdb would be secondary scsi/sata drive :)
do you own the mount folder?
to make yourself the owner of a directory or file, type sudo chown <username>:<username> /<path>
to make that user the owner of all files and folders under that path, use -R
